div.p: I have said Something about A great many me before This but i had Saw None until we got on The advance as it ware In aline of battle and We could See the troop To to the rite and left of us on the line as far as far as we could See boath ways the Woods are alive with Troops and horses and Mules and the ground Coverd with waggons And tents whare we are Now our pickets and The rebels pickets are A shooting at Each other Most all the time with But any affect they kill

One once awhile in boath Sides but verry Seldom I was verry Sorry to hear That Simon marshall was dead Such things Must be allso Henry Gaver i could hardly Beleave it for awhile I Shall have to Close My remark to you And Say a few word To to the boys I Want you to prey for Me when ever you Can I for got one Thing you said Some Thing about Mrs gheen Getting $70 dollars you had better that Thay us while it is plenty So good by

To Isaiah and george Now boys from the way you all write I think you are doing verry well i hope you will continue So untill get home and You will See things That you never saw Something good to eat And drink Boath for You and your mother you must watch the Squirrels out of your Corn field when it Begins to come up And tend it the best you can for the Roots i think you Can raise Some good In that new ground

If it is well tended And a good season Now be right good Boys and do your work well what you do I would like to know Whether your bread Stuff was agoing to Last you till after Harvest or not No more at present But Still remain Affectionate father untill Death
